paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Create Cloudair in PostgreSQL
**Objective:** Become familiar with using ETL tools such as NiFi and Sqoop
**File locations:** hostname:~/data/cloudair
**Successful outcome:** Understanding ETL for NiFi and Sqoop
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** NiFi and Scoop

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Create Cloudair in PostgreSQL
Objective: Become familiar with using ETL tools such as NiFi and Sqoop
File locations: hostname:~/data/cloudair
Successful outcome: Understanding ETL for NiFi and Sqoop
Before you begin: N/A
Related lessons: NiFi and Scoop

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Retrieve the files from devuser
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r /tmp/cloudair
mkdir /tmp/cloudair
cp /home/devuser/data/cloudair/* /tmp/cloudair/

paragraphs.title: List the directory /tmp/cloudair
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ls /tmp/cloudair/

msg.data:
claim_savings.csv.bz2
eu_countries.csv.bz2
pos_txt.csv.bz2
provider_summary.csv.bz2
tax_2020.csv.bz2
us_customers.csv.bz2
ww_customers.csv.bz2

paragraphs.title: Use bunzip2 to extract the files
paragraphs.text:
%sh
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/claim_savings.csv.bz2
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/eu_countries.csv.bz2
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/pos_txt.csv.bz2
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/provider_summary.csv.bz2
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/tax_2020.csv.bz2
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/us_customers.csv.bz2
bunzip2 /tmp/cloudair/ww_customers.csv.bz2

paragraphs.title: List the contents of /tmp/cloudair
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ls /tmp/cloudair

msg.data:
claim_savings.csv
eu_countries.csv
pos_txt.csv
provider_summary.csv
tax_2020.csv
us_customers.csv
ww_customers.csv

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab

%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive materialized view.

---

msg.data:
Result

You have now: You have now successfully created a Hive materialized view.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Solution
---

paragraphs.title: Use shell Interpreter to list postgresql databases
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -p 5432 -d cloudair <<EOF
\dt
EOF

msg.data:
List of relations
 Schema |     Name     | Type  |  Owner  
--------+--------------+-------+---------
 public | us_customers | table | devuser
 public | ww_customers | table | devuser
(2 rows)

paragraphs.title: Create table claim_savings
paragraphs.text:
%psql

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS claim_savings;

CREATE TABLE claim_savings(
    reportdate DATE,
    name VARCHAR(128),
    sequenceid INT,
    claimid INT,
    costsaving NUMERIC (10, 2),
    eligibilitycode NUMERIC (10, 2),
    latitude NUMERIC (12, 8),
    longitude NUMERIC (12, 8)
);

paragraphs.title: Load data into claim_savings
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -p 5432 -d cloudair <<EOF
\copy claim_savings FROM '/tmp/cloudair/claim_savings.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV
EOF

paragraphs.title: Query table claim_savings limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%psql
SELECT * FROM claim_savings LIMIT 5;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Create table eu_countries
Load data into eu_countries
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -p 5432 -d cloudair <<EOF
\copy eu_countries FROM '/tmp/cloudair/eu_countries.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV
EOF

paragraphs.title: Query table eu_countries limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%psql
SELECT * From eu_countries limit 5;

paragraphs.title: Create table provider_summary
paragraphs.text:
%psql
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS provider_summary;

CREATE TABLE provider_summary(
    providerid INT,
    providername VARCHAR(64),
    providerstreetaddress VARCHAR(64),
    providercity VARCHAR(24),
    providerstate VARCHAR(4),
    providerzip INT,
    providerreferralregion VARCHAR(64),
    totaldischarges INT,
    averagecoveredcharges NUMERIC (10,2),
    averagetotalpayments NUMERIC (10,2),
    averagemedicarepayment NUMERIC (10,2)
);

paragraphs.title: Load data into provider_summary
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -p 5432 -d cloudair <<EOF
\copy provider_summary FROM '/tmp/cloudair/provider_summary.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV
EOF

paragraphs.title: Query table provider_summary limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%psql
SELECT * FROM provider_summary LIMIT 5;

paragraphs.title: Create table us_customers
paragraphs.text:
%psql
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS us_customers;

CREATE TABLE us_customers(
    RowNum Int,
    Title VARCHAR(8),
    FirstName VARCHAR(64),
    MiddleInitial VARCHAR(4),
    LastName VARCHAR(64),
    NameSet VARCHAR(24),
    StreetAddress VARCHAR(128),
    City VARCHAR(64),
    State VARCHAR(8),
    StateFull VARCHAR(64),
    Zipcode VARCHAR(12),
    Country VARCHAR(8),
    CountryFull VARCHAR(64),
    TelephoneCountryCode VARCHAR(4),
    TelephoneNumber VARCHAR(24),
    EmailAddress VARCHAR(64),
    Username VARCHAR(24),
    Password VARCHAR(24),
    NationalID VARCHAR(12),
    MRN VARCHAR (64),
    InsuranceID Int,
    CCType VARCHAR(24),
    CCNumber VARCHAR(24),
    CVV2 Int,
    CCExpires Date,
    Occupation VARCHAR(128),
    Company VARCHAR(64),
    Domain VARCHAR(64),
    Vehicle VARCHAR(64),
    Gender VARCHAR(12),
    MothersMaiden VARCHAR(64),
    Birthday Date,
    TropicalZodiac VARCHAR(24),
    Age Int,
    EyeColor VARCHAR(12),
    BloodType VARCHAR(4),
    Weight NUMERIC (6, 2),
    Height NUMERIC (6, 2),
    Latitude NUMERIC (12, 8),
    Longitude NUMERIC (12, 8)
    );

paragraphs.title: Load data into us_customers
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -p 5432 -d cloudair <<EOF
\copy us_customers FROM '/tmp/cloudair/us_customers.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV HEADER
EOF

paragraphs.title: Query table us_customers limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%psql
SELECT * FROM us_customers LIMIT 5;

paragraphs.title: Create table ww_customers
paragraphs.text:
%psql
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS ww_customers;

CREATE TABLE ww_customers(
    RowNum Int,
    Title VARCHAR(8),
    FirstName VARCHAR(64),
    MiddleInitial VARCHAR(4),
    LastName VARCHAR(64),
    NameSet VARCHAR(24),
    StreetAddress VARCHAR(128),
    City VARCHAR(64),
    State VARCHAR(8),
    StateFull VARCHAR(64),
    Zipcode VARCHAR(12),
    Country VARCHAR(8),
    CountryFull VARCHAR(64),
    TelephoneCountryCode VARCHAR(4),
    TelephoneNumber VARCHAR(24),
    EmailAddress VARCHAR(64),
    Username VARCHAR(24),
    Password VARCHAR(24),
    NationalID VARCHAR(24),
    MRN VARCHAR (64),
    InsuranceID Int,
    CCType VARCHAR(24),
    CCNumber VARCHAR(24),
    CVV2 Int,
    CCExpires VARCHAR(12),
    Occupation VARCHAR(128),
    Company VARCHAR(64),
    Domain VARCHAR(64),
    Vehicle VARCHAR(64),
    Gender VARCHAR(12),
    MothersMaiden VARCHAR(64),
    Birthday VARCHAR(12),
    TropicalZodiac VARCHAR(24),
    Age Int,
    EyeColor VARCHAR(12),
    BloodType VARCHAR(4),
    Weight NUMERIC (6, 2),
    Height NUMERIC (6, 2),
    Latitude NUMERIC (12, 8),
    Longitude NUMERIC (12, 8)
    );

paragraphs.title: Load data into ww_customers
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -p 5432 -d cloudair <<EOF
\copy ww_customers FROM '/tmp/cloudair/ww_customers.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV HEADER
EOF

%psql
select * from ww_customers limit 5;

paragraphs.title: Delete the  directory for the staging data
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r  /tmp/cloudair

%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Cloudera Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Cloudera Community Connection (HCC) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Cloudera Apache Spark Docs - official Spark documentation.
  4. Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs - official Zeppelin documentation.
